result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J. Kennedy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon J. Kennedy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon J. Kennedy was found guilty of False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Brandon J. Kennedy was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:05 a.m. Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Steven Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Impact statement filed. Michlig statement to sentencing. Van Wagner/Kennedy statement to sentencing- speaks to 3 factors:  gravity & seriousness of offense; character; & need to protect community. Court statement/speaks to considerations. Michlig speaks to victim impact--requests restitution. Court orders State to file info. within 60 days. 

Court sentence - Ct. 2/False Imprisonment
WHS
2 yrs. POP
AODA assessment and follow through
4 mos. county jail; commence on or before 9/18/15 at 8:00 a.m.
Huber
Restorative Justice System, if victim willing to participate
75 days' credit upon revocation
CC/CV/Supervision
DNA surcharge
Restitution - to be determined

Court sentence - Ct. 5/OWI 2d - concurrent to Ct. 2
WHS
2 yrs. POP
45 days county jail; commence on or before 9/18/15 at 8:00 a.m.
Huber

$35 Blood Draw Surcharge
14 mos. d.l. revoked 
1 yr. IID 
Alcohol assessment/driver safety plan
Appeal rights given
Adj. 12:04 p.m.

03:44 PM - Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf35, 14cf93, 5cf36, 12cf162, 14cf47 and 14tr593.  Joint request to enter pleas today and set over for sentencing.  State will not rescind case 12cf162 and DPA will continue for two more years.  State moves to dismiss 15cf35, 14cf93, 15cf36 and 14tr593 - Granted.  In case 14cf47 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 5.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bail continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Request for Production of Exculpatory Evidence
for Discovery of "other conduct" evidence
for Production of Physical Evidence

03:09 pm - Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf35 (Initial), 14cf47 (set for JT), 12cf162, 15cf36 (Initial), 14cf93 and 14tr593.  Van Wagner statement to status of cases.  Defense has not rec'd all of the discovery information as of today's date.  In 15cf35 and 36 - Van Wagner - Will not proceed with Initial appearance on both cases today.  Court sig bond $3500 each case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
from Michlig regarding substitution of attorney

10:12 a.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court. Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy does not appear. Steven Mitchell Michlig. Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF47, 14CF93, 12CF162, 15CF35, 15CF36. Court speaks to 14CF47 & 14CF93/scheduled for JT on 2/6/15 - court in receipt of motion to withdraw by Attorney Hogan. Hogan statement--explains defendant's nonappearance/hiring private counsel, Mr. VonWagner. 10:15 a.m. off the record. 10:19 a.m. back on record--same parties present. Attorney Chris VanWagner appears by phone. Hogan statement on motion to withdraw. Michlig statement--proposal has been made/does not object to substitution of counsel and adjournment. VanWagner statement-requests time to review files/allow to appear for further status. Court grants motion to withdraw. VanWagner states he has been formally retained. 15CF35/15CF36 initial appearances scheduled for 3/25/15 at 3:00 p.m. 12CF162 & 14TR593 set for status on same date.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

01:38 pm - Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf47, 14cf93 and 14tr593.  Michlig states a proposal was submitted to defense.  Hogan states met with defendant regarding proposal which has been rejected.  Requests more time in the hope that a resolution is still possible short of trial.  Court sets for trial.  Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

also calling 14CF47  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Atty Hogan statement to court states has not come to an agreement yet and asks for time on both cases.  Court sets over to 12-02-2014 at 1:30 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

11:07 a.m. Defendant Brandon J. Kennedy in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF93 & 14TR593. Michlig statement as to patient treatment. Hogan statement--defendant did not engage in treatment/has enrolled in college; in process of reaching resolution. State requests preliminary hearing on 14CF93. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 10:15 am.
